skill.name: Frontend Accessibility
skill.description: Build accessible user interfaces using semantic HTML, ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, color contrast, and screen reader compatibility. Use this skill when creating or modifying HTML templates, React/Vue components, forms, interactive elements, navigation menus, modals, or any UI code. Apply when implementing keyboard navigation, focus management, alt text for images, form labels, heading structure, color contrast, or testing with screen readers. Use for all frontend development to ensure interfaces are usable by people with disabilities and meet WCAG accessibility standards.

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation file with no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. This skill provides accessibility guidelines only.

content.value_statement: Building accessible web interfaces is challenging without clear guidelines on semantic HTML, ARIA attributes, and WCAG compliance. This skill provides Claude with comprehensive accessibility best practices to create inclusive UIs that work for users with disabilities.
actual_capabilities: Generate semantic HTML elements for better structure and accessibility
Add proper ARIA attributes to enhance screen reader compatibility
Implement keyboard navigation and focus management in interactive components
Ensure color contrast meets WCAG guidelines for visual accessibility
Create accessible forms with proper labels and validation messages
Build accessible modals, dropdowns, and dynamic UI components
limitations: Cannot test actual screen reader output or perform automated accessibility audits
Cannot access existing codebases to refactor - only provides guidance for new code
Does not include WCAG documentation reference file (linked document not present)

prompt_templates.title: Basic Form Accessibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an accessible registration form with proper labels, error messages, and keyboard navigation using this skill

prompt_templates.title: Modal Accessibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an accessible modal component with focus trapping, ARIA attributes, and escape key support

prompt_templates.title: Navigation Menu
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an accessible navigation menu with proper semantic HTML, ARIA roles, and keyboard support

prompt_templates.title: WCAG Compliance Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this React component for WCAG AA compliance and suggest accessibility improvements

output_examples.input: Create an accessible button component with proper ARIA support
output: Use <button> element for actions (not <div> with click handlers)
Add aria-label for icon-only buttons with descriptive text
Include visible focus styles with sufficient color contrast (4.5:1 minimum)
Support keyboard activation via Enter and Space keys
Add aria-disabled or disabled attribute for non-interactive buttons

best_practices: Use native HTML elements (button, nav, main, article) before custom ARIA solutions
Test keyboard navigation manually - ensure all interactive elements are reachable and usable
Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA (4.5:1 for text) or AAA (7:1) standards
anti_patterns: Using div elements with click handlers instead of semantic button elements
Missing or duplicate IDs for form labels and input fields
Creating keyboard traps where users cannot escape modal dialogs or dropdown menus
Using color alone to convey information (add icons, text, or patterns for visual impairments)

faq.question: What WCAG levels does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Provides guidance for both WCAG AA and AAA compliance levels including contrast ratios and accessibility requirements

faq.question: Does this skill work with React, Vue, and plain HTML?
faq.answer: Yes, the accessibility guidelines apply to all frontend frameworks and plain HTML templates

faq.question: Can this skill audit existing code for accessibility issues?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidelines for writing accessible code but does not perform automated audits on existing codebases

faq.question: What ARIA attributes are covered?
faq.answer: Common ARIA attributes including aria-label, aria-describedby, aria-expanded, aria-modal, and role definitions

faq.question: Does the skill include color contrast checking tools?
faq.answer:: The skill provides color contrast guidelines and WCAG ratios but does not include contrast calculation tools

faq.question: How is this skill different from other accessibility tools?
faq.answer: This skill embeds accessibility expertise directly into Claude's code generation process for immediate implementation
